npm install							npm install
```								```

### Installing useful tools					### Installing useful tools

Postbird is a useful client GUI (graphical user interface) to	Postbird is a useful client GUI (graphical user interface) to

#### 2. [Postman](https://www.getpostman.com/downloads/)	#### 2. [Postman](https://www.getpostman.com/downloads/)

```								```

This is a javascript object containing a list of cars. This w	This is a javascript object containing a list of cars. This w

CREATE VIEW joined AS					      |	CREATE VIEW joined
							      >	AS

  FROM cars							  FROM cars
  INNER JOIN make ON (cars.make_id = make.id)			    INNER JOIN make ON (cars.make_id = make.id)
  ORDER BY cost DESC  LIMIT 30;					  ORDER BY cost DESC  LIMIT 30;

Jul 16 19:49 2020 diff -rwly course-02/exercises/udacity-c2-frontend/README.md /Users/amitsoni/Desktop/Solutions-Cloud-Deve/course-02/exercises/udacity-c2-frontend/README.md Page 1


# Udagram Simple Frontend					# Udagram Simple Frontend

Udagram is a simple cloud application developed along side th	Udagram is a simple cloud application developed along side th

The project is split into three parts:				The project is split into three parts:
1. [The Simple Frontend](https://github.com/udacity/cloud-dev	1. [The Simple Frontend](https://github.com/udacity/cloud-dev
A basic Ionic client web application which consumes the RestA	A basic Ionic client web application which consumes the RestA
2. [The RestAPI Backend](https://github.com/udacity/cloud-dev	2. [The RestAPI Backend](https://github.com/udacity/cloud-dev
3. [The Image Filtering Microservice](https://github.com/udac	3. [The Image Filtering Microservice](https://github.com/udac
***								***

## Getting Setup						## Getting Setup

> _tip_: this frontend is designed to work with [The RestAPI 	> _tip_: this frontend is designed to work with [The RestAPI 

### Installing Node and NPM					### Installing Node and NPM
This project depends on Nodejs and Node Package Manager (NPM)	This project depends on Nodejs and Node Package Manager (NPM)

### Installing Ionic Cli					### Installing Ionic Cli
The Ionic Command Line Interface is required to serve and bui	The Ionic Command Line Interface is required to serve and bui

### Installing project dependencies				### Installing project dependencies

This project uses NPM to manage software dependencies. NPM Re	This project uses NPM to manage software dependencies. NPM Re
```bash								```bash
npm install							npm install
```								```
>_tip_: **npm i** is shorthand for **npm install**		>_tip_: **npm i** is shorthand for **npm install**

### Configure The Backend Endpoint				### Configure The Backend Endpoint
Ionic uses enviornment files located in `./src/enviornments/e |	Ionic uses environment files located in `./src/environments/e

***								***
### Running the Development Server				### Running the Development Server
Ionic CLI provides an easy to use development server to run a	Ionic CLI provides an easy to use development server to run a

```bash								```bash
ionic serve							ionic serve
```								```

### Building the Static Frontend Files				### Building the Static Frontend Files
Ionic CLI can build the frontend into static HTML/CSS/JavaScr	Ionic CLI can build the frontend into static HTML/CSS/JavaScr
```bash								```bash
ionic build							ionic build
```								```
***								***

  }								  }

        Validators.required,					        Validators.required,

        this.loginForm.controls.email.value,			        this.loginForm.controls.email.value,

      });							      });

import { User } from '../models/user.model';			import { User } from '../models/user.model';

const JWT_LOCALSTORE_KEY = 'jwt';				const JWT_LOCALSTORE_KEY = 'jwt';
const USER_LOCALSTORE_KEY = 'user';				const USER_LOCALSTORE_KEY = 'user';

@Injectable({							@Injectable({
  providedIn: 'root'						  providedIn: 'root'

  initToken() {							  initToken() {

    }								    }
  }								  }

  setTokenAndUser(token: string, user: User) {			  setTokenAndUser(token: string, user: User) {

    this.api.setAuthToken(token);				    this.api.setAuthToken(token);

  }								  }

  }								  }

  }								  }

# Udagram REST API						# Udagram REST API

Udagram is a simple cloud application developed alongside the	Udagram is a simple cloud application developed alongside the

The project is split into three parts:				The project is split into three parts:
1. [The Simple Frontend](https://github.com/udacity/cloud-dev	1. [The Simple Frontend](https://github.com/udacity/cloud-dev
A basic Ionic client web application which consumes the RestA	A basic Ionic client web application which consumes the RestA
2. [The RestAPI Backend](https://github.com/udacity/cloud-dev	2. [The RestAPI Backend](https://github.com/udacity/cloud-dev
3. [The Image Filtering Microservice](https://github.com/udac	3. [The Image Filtering Microservice](https://github.com/udac


***								***
## Getting Setup						## Getting Setup

```bash								```bash
npm install							npm install
```								```
>_tip_: **npm i** is shorthand for **npm install**		>_tip_: **npm i** is shorthand for **npm install**

### Installing useful tools					### Installing useful tools
#### 1. [Postbird](https://github.com/paxa/postbird)		#### 1. [Postbird](https://github.com/paxa/postbird)
Postbird is a useful client GUI (graphical user interface) to	Postbird is a useful client GUI (graphical user interface) to

#### 2. [Postman](https://www.getpostman.com/downloads/)	#### 2. [Postman](https://www.getpostman.com/downloads/)
Postman is a useful tool to issue and save requests. Postman 	Postman is a useful tool to issue and save requests. Postman

# Udagram Image Filtering Microservice				# Udagram Image Filtering Microservice

Udagram is a simple cloud application developed alongside the	Udagram is a simple cloud application developed alongside the

The project is split into three parts:				The project is split into three parts:
1. [The Simple Frontend](https://github.com/udacity/cloud-dev	1. [The Simple Frontend](https://github.com/udacity/cloud-dev
A basic Ionic client web application which consumes the RestA	A basic Ionic client web application which consumes the RestA
2. [The RestAPI Backend](https://github.com/udacity/cloud-dev	2. [The RestAPI Backend](https://github.com/udacity/cloud-dev
3. [The Image Filtering Microservice](https://github.com/udac	3. [The Image Filtering Microservice](https://github.com/udac

## Tasks							## Tasks

### Setup Node Environment					### Setup Node Environment

You'll need to create a new node server. Open a new terminal 	You'll need to create a new node server. Open a new terminal 

1. Initialize a new project: `npm i`				1. Initialize a new project: `npm i`
2. run the development server with `npm run dev`		2. run the development server with `npm run dev`

### Create a new endpoint in the server.ts file			### Create a new endpoint in the server.ts file

The starter code has a task for you to complete an endpoint i	The starter code has a task for you to complete an endpoint i

We've included a few helper functions to handle some of these	We've included a few helper functions to handle some of these

```typescript							```typescript
import {filterImageFromURL, deleteLocalFiles} from './util/ut	import {filterImageFromURL, deleteLocalFiles} from './util/ut
```								```

### Deploying your system					### Deploying your system

Follow the process described in the course to `eb init` a new	Follow the process described in the course to `eb init` a new

							      >
## Stand Out (Optional)						## Stand Out (Optional)

### Refactor the course RESTapi					### Refactor the course RESTapi

If you're feeling up to it, refactor the course RESTapi to ma	If you're feeling up to it, refactor the course RESTapi to ma

### Authentication						### Authentication

Prevent requests without valid authentication headers.		Prevent requests without valid authentication headers.
> !!NOTE if you choose to submit this, make sure to add the t	> !!NOTE if you choose to submit this, make sure to add the t

### Custom Domain Name						### Custom Domain Name

Add your own domain name and have it point to the running ser	Add your own domain name and have it point to the running ser
> !NOTE: Domain names are not included in AWS’ free tier and 	> !NOTE: Domain names are not included in AWS’ free tier and

import fs from 'fs';					      |	import fs from "fs";
import Jimp = require('jimp');				      |	import Jimp from "jimp";

// filterImageFromURL						// filterImageFromURL
// helper function to download, filter, and save the filtered	// helper function to download, filter, and save the filtered
// returns the absolute path to the local image			// returns the absolute path to the local image
// INPUTS							// INPUTS
//    inputURL: string - a publicly accessible url to an imag	//    inputURL: string - a publicly accessible url to an imag
// RETURNS							// RETURNS
//    an absolute path to a filtered image locally saved file	//    an absolute path to a filtered image locally saved file
export async function filterImageFromURL(inputURL: string): P	export async function filterImageFromURL(inputURL: string): P
    return new Promise( async resolve => {			  return new Promise(async resolve => {
        const photo = await Jimp.read(inputURL);		    const photo = await Jimp.read(inputURL);
        const outpath = '/tmp/filtered.'+Math.floor(Math.rand |	    const outpath =
							      >	      "/tmp/filtered." + Math.floor(Math.random() * 2000) + "
        await photo						    await photo
        .resize(256, 256) // resize				      .resize(256, 256) // resize
        .quality(60) // set JPEG quality			      .quality(60) // set JPEG quality
        .greyscale() // set greyscale				      .greyscale() // set greyscale
        .write(__dirname+outpath, (img)=>{		      |	      .write(__dirname + outpath, img => {
            resolve(__dirname+outpath);				        resolve(__dirname + outpath);
        });							      });
    });								  });
}								}

// deleteLocalFiles						// deleteLocalFiles
// helper function to delete files on the local disk		// helper function to delete files on the local disk
// useful to cleanup after tasks				// useful to cleanup after tasks
// INPUTS							// INPUTS
//    files: Array<string> an array of absolute paths to file	//    files: Array<string> an array of absolute paths to file
export async function deleteLocalFiles(files:Array<string>){	export async function deleteLocalFiles(files: Array<string>) 
    for( let file of files) {					  for (let file of files) {
        fs.unlinkSync(file);					    fs.unlinkSync(file);
    }								  }
}								}
